title: Website loads fast on Chrome but slow on Firefox — performance issue on home electrification site
content:
Hi everyone, I’m experiencing a browser-specific performance issue with a website called Electrify My Home.

which focuses on home electrification solutions such as heat pump water heaters, heat pump HVAC systems, insulation upgrades, and energy-efficient home improvements. The site loads quickly on Google Chrome, but on Mozilla Firefox it feels noticeably slower, particularly on the first load and when navigating between pages related to heat pump water heaters and other service sections.

I’m trying to understand what might cause Firefox-specific slowdowns, such as differences in JavaScript execution, CSS rendering, font loading, third-party scripts, or browser compatibility. I’d also appreciate recommendations on using Firefox developer tools (like the Performance tab or Network analysis) to diagnose these issues, as well as best practices to improve load speed and overall performance in Firefox without negatively affecting Chrome.

Any insights, debugging tips, or real-world examples would be greatly appreciated.
creator: johngasperemh

title: Migrating from Chrome to Firefox browser
content:
Newly installed FF browser. Tried transferring bookmarks from Chrome to FF using "import bookmarks" menu. Appended .csv file without error but still bookmarks cannot be seen. Tried method two. Using Chrome bookmark manager, downloaded .html file. Used FF again to append without error but the same no bookmarks seen.

Is it really impossible to automatically transfer bookmarks from Chrome to FF?
creator: sc888ph

title: Firefox And Youtube Captions
content:
Youtube has two settings that must be turned on for captions to show and start automatically when watching a video. "Always Show Captions" and "Auto Play Captions" and not be forced to be signed in to YT. Both settings must be checked off/turned on for captions to work and "set" in the cookies, for captions to work when not signed into YT.

Previously, one could sign in to YT, re-select the settings, refresh browser and then sign out and the captions would work when signed out and viewing YT content.

Since your update today, YT's "auto play captions" option is now missing when using Firefox, but not when using chrome, meaning when using Firefox, it can't be selected while using that browser. The result is that persons who choose to use Firefox instead and don't want to be signed in to youtube, not wanting our information followed in a non anonymous manner, can't use firefox to watch YT and still have captions working without having to constantly turn them on for every single video watched (that's where "auto play captions" came in).

Bad, bad move. On both mozilla's part and YT's.
creator: ayres29754
